text: these days most young Cubans idolize a
singer or maybe a baseball star but
eight-year-old Malin Mendez is a fan of
Fidel Castro his bedroom wall is
plastered in pictures of the
revolutionary hermanas got some prized
new photographs for his collection
invited him and all the family to his
house I felt very moved because it was
my dream when I saw him my mother was
shaking she was crying tears were
falling it was my dream to meet Fidel we
all gave him a hug Fidel was in power in
Cuba for almost five decades but Marlon
never knew him as president Fidel was
forced to step down through ill health
per year the boy was born now 88 Castro
is rarely seen or heard from so his
condition has become a source of
speculation both for those who hailed
him as a hero and those who condemned
him as the dictator but Fidel was well
enough to dedicate this to his great
friend Marlon and his family said Castro
stood up to greet them and to chat about
many things or gently I join yourself 88
is 88 Mullins grandma says but I'd like
to be like Fidel at 88 and she added the
comandante a its with us for the long
haul surprise visits aside though Fidel
does seem destined to stay out of the
public eye now a whole generation of
Cubans is growing up without him but it
seems without forgetting him Sara
answered BBC News Havana
